ud7.7:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud7.7:1.3: Now at that time the Buddha was sitting reviewing his own giving up of the judgments driven by the proliferation of perceptions.
ud7.7:2.1: Then, understanding his own giving up of the judgments driven by the proliferation of perceptions, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud7.7:3.1: “There is no proliferation remaining in those
ud7.7:3.2: who have gone beyond the halter and cross-bar.
ud7.7:3.3: The sage who lives without craving
ud7.7:3.4: is never scorned by the world with its gods.”
